062C4CFDE012492389DEC319DE7B8792.description: The student will demonstrate appropriate customs in various liturgical situations.

86B171FA31EC4354933F26DE93F0EC55.description: The student will demonstrate appropriate reverence during prayer.

3E62998A30564B3095E32165DBE1C8F6.description: The student will demonstrate the use of different types of prayer.

9855A3AA8BA044C08433BBF17650FAE0.description: The student will participate in traditional Marian devotions.

A5E46FAB33D24E90B213B9BD7C17AF2E.description: The student will participate in meditative prayer

4279FD17C2634EA8B6E3891DA3152798.description: The student will discuss and/or participate in Eucharistic devotions such as Adoration, Forty Hours, and Benediction

D260B55BB70341B6886D1823DD6232C7.description: The student will pray for openness and generous response to God's call in their lives.

58008BF6CFFA4370B015620A64707AC6.description: The student will discuss the effectiveness of prayer in working toward peace and justice.

75FD6ECDBE1D4139982D2E85A2A4B11F.description: The student will recite common prayers of the Catholic Church (see Appendix).

13454DE8FE7E45138A35D0BD76D7CD66.description: The student will identify the vocations in the church and describe their roles.

901EE8BC8ACE444AB31EDB1AC2C23DD7.description: The student will retell the life of a saint who modeled social justice

D362BEFC486C4596BC1F64F1BA889220.description: The student will help design, organize, and/or participate in a student-directed service project

0C8E90456D084B7E9226EEE7677E0BBA.description: The student will take age-appropriate action to make their voices heard on social justice issues (i.e., write letters to congressman, respect life essays, cleaning up trash, recycling, etc.)

292FB21208884937A50D86000A6B521B.description: The student will relate the Spiritual and Corporal Works of Mercy to works of social justice.

F6DF375684C14B7991282BCE84CC992E.description: The student will explain the principles of social justice (see Appendix for resources.)

EF642EF972F34E5F9F28B86AD08665D3.description: The student will discuss that every right has a corresponding responsibility. Identify some responsibilities related to the rights of human persons.

DC332CEE4D1C4952B9DF6CB19A75F02D.description: The student will create suggestions for peaceful alternatives and solutions for poverty, violence, oppression, etc. which rob persons of their human dignity.

113529FAF0C8470880B33BE9BA8FFD5E.description: The student will assess how Catholic values help us make social, economic, and political choices.

FF14EC18C6004AF4A73972E9E53585BF.description: The student will identify that God puts us in the world to know, to love, and to serve him, and so to come to paradise and this is the goal of the moral life (CCC 1721).

838CCA7F0DA74BBCB93C2FD9F6C2F877.description: The student will explain that the Beatitudes respond to the natural desire for happiness (CCC 1718).

0F1C4D2D46C2435481061E2726F62D9A.description: The student will identify the three parts of the moral act; the object, the intention, and the circumstances (CCC 1750).

BF7F7499295C4DF3A132BB5B126497AF.description: The student will identify that prayer allows access to the grace that allows us to be good (CCC 1742)

8E4ACF9B38994669B09A1F453D8C1416.description: The student will identify grace as the power by which we live out the moral life.

81BF2968A59E45CB97A4F1E9D709A579.description: The student will identify grace as the source of healing for the wound of original sin.

E56484577A21458AB31B4FBDB5F1F78E.description: The student will recite and analyze the Two Great Commandments.

A442DBEDE3EC4046BAB5971E98767525.description: The student will evaluate a situation where God's law is in conflict with human law.

4F2D216BAD664553BF4F71D66A309109.description: The student will explain that God's laws are above human laws.

0B590A81BCDA44A298CA1511DB7B9A6A.description: The student will identify universal moral truths.

A9B640B95B794F83B4E847A7C11C2010.description: The student will define the role of conscience and circumstance in moral decision-making.

4DD13C421CDA4494977F67FD7A1F2359.description: The student will dramatize and/or demonstrate ways to use the virtues to respond to situations involving personal and/or social sin (CCC 1869).

C435C9C91E53432CAC642FE1C8674F44.description: The student will define and give some examples of social sin (CCC 1869).

29F09A2BEA804F79BAF4362C81F79E29.description: The student will charitably explain and defend Catholic doctrine using history, Sacred Scripture and common sense.

57CFD5F9B1A54F9CA3AB041319AD0352.description: The student will describe how each vocation builds up the body of Christ.

7DA2FD0FF748474E9B48F3358CD91961.description: The student will describe the benefits and challenges of vocations to the single, married, religious, or ordained life.

DD36878F0F6443D8A4E2A2E025A308C8.description: The student will describe how their membership in the Body of Christ gives them a responsibility to each other member of the human community.

E0C87735B3F24CF4A0BAA5FAD0BF8F6D.description: The student will explain how Baptism connects them to a universal community of believers beginning with their own parish community.

DC061E790D1644E39B86A55208F3AAA9.description: The student will explain that Baptism includes a call to be leaven in the world.

FF7C8BB2FAD1447E9F2BE19FF47E5705.description: The student will define modesty in relation to dress and behavior.

4CD10EA3AC224749BB6510DF7BF8B671.description: The student will evaluate contemporary lifestyles and identify those that undermine the value of life.

FF668A7B68A54481BFDBBE0890F7EF13.description: The student will discuss appropriate responses to pornography and explain that pornography denigrates the human condition.

F98C1DC4FAAD4B85A08636A5C0F4A83D.description: The student will discuss touching safety.

D5CF71AB42F4473686DB7FC64FD6D856.description: The student will explore situations and appropriate responses when peer pressure impacts the decisions one makes both positively and negatively.

87D41066FECC4B029D529F08A4CDB50D.description: The student will discuss the changes in relationships with persons of the other gender.

EDAE05DBF90E43CBAFDE242953840065.description: The student will demonstrate familiarity with the teachings of the Catholic Church regarding sexual moral values and behavior by discussing appropriate choices in contemporary, real-life, situations.

90EEABE697CE4D16ACA7A92CC8336EDE.description: The student will describe the value of the virtue of chastity and ways to live a chaste life. (See the definition of chastity in the glossary of CCC, p. 870.)

92B07AFA95174049BBE9C5F22342A102.description: The student will explain the Church's teachings regarding family  planning and birth control.

C6172F8E5F00441EB9BEF865B33FD5A7.description: The student will identify the two purposes of marriage as unity/mutual support and procreation.

F1DFB162AE784D359C4BD93106910CBD.description: The student will define marriage as the one flesh union between husband and wife modeled after Christ's union with the Church.

932D7716620E4DC898AB053105F03253.description: The student will compare and contrast the true image of marital love as God intended versus contemporary media portrayals of love.

78C03E00EC354043ABC05963EE0D6936.description: The student will discuss the deeper meaning of Christ's commandment "to love one another as I have loved you" as it applies to spousal love.

E05A57CD09B34FA3B68A5703E9F0462C.description: The student will discuss and apply guidelines for choosing movies, TV programs, music, books, magazines, video games, etc. that are supportive of human dignity.

161E7490E2C946A3A4C771F3FAB07300.description: The student will identify local, national and/or global situations in which the dignity of the human person is not respected.

B0D3EFE487504964BFCD8F2E83992550.description: The student will compare and contrast Christian and secular norms for "success."

1AB2D8FF0B4E45FEA8AA534A8D9358C9.description: The student will describe and give examples from early Church history of the Christian ideal for respecting others.

3C9BEDBB70FE4244AD7B0FEBDF4B4E2D.description: The student will identify some basic rights of all human persons .

5808433194FC49808A453E730101B195.description: The student will describe all human life as sacred from conception to natural death .

BCC27A9EA6A74134809D33BC24A9E35E.description: The student will discuss the source of human dignity as our being created in the image and likeness of God.

D1B9F70562234AAE9C29B3850B929088.description: The student will discuss Eucharist as the source and summit of the life of a Catholic.

C7CC78E3B3AC492A8820FE106933CC5A.description: The student will describe real-life situations in which they have need of the fruits and gifts of the Holy Spirit.

D8FA254A01614FD6AA9348EDE38522E5.description: The student will list from memory and discuss the gifts and fruits of the Holy Spirit.

3EF52FC378514A838C8F7D201E9075E4.description: The student will examine Confirmation as one of the sacraments of initiation.

2F8A9534C0DE4AC2BBC5D844DABACC88.description: The student will define and explain Confirmation as the "sacrament that completes the grace of Baptism by a special outpouring of the gifts of the Holy Spirit which seal or confirm the baptized in union with Christ and equip them for Active participation in the worship and apostolic life of the Church. (CCC 1285)" (See Glossary of the CCC p. 872).

A5A7AF55F22A43278C21F506CC860E73.description: The student will identify the sacraments of initiation and discuss application to their daily lives.

E7A4E7E040E44013A3B8AF15DB00BD96.description: The student will discuss the Sunday (A, B, C) and Daily (I, II) cycles of readings.

94633BA2FDA447D9B95B409CFFF6BCF0.description: The student will define Lectionary and explain the purpose of the Lectionary.

42B5F4ECA082434B8F8F3D9B6B796C52.description: The student will read, discuss, and reflect on the readings from the upcoming Sunday.

20C6B8CD55154DC5893CB2476B3F44F9.description: The student will recite the Holy Days of Obligation including their dates.

58C45F35F8E64635B58041C1374CAF5D.description: The student will participate regularly in the Sacrament of Reconciliation.

2FC7416AE1A64B81B405170FC3E846FD.description: The student will participate regularly in the planning and the celebration of the Eucharist (i.e. writing the intercessory prayers, acting as lector, cantor, acolyte, gift bearers, ushers, etc.).

4F24FD9309D54EE9BBCD878C574480BA.description: Strand II: Celebration of the Christian Mystery

21B89E8840594F789EA7658124721D1A.description: The student will memorize the precepts of the Church and give the major understandings of each one.

F1F6D1D66B194598A11FB2350F301E31.description: The student will compare the Apostle's Creed and the Nicene Creed.

51F782DB11F9496EA8F704A58CF9CB87.description: The student will analyze the Nicene Creed and analyze its elements.

697A0EEE01FC41418B8CDA96623360E4.description: The student will describe the hierarchy of the Catholic Church. Explain some of the responsibilities of the membership of each group.

9886042FB0C04126994DF364431C924F.description: The student will define the doctrine of Papal Infallibility and the primacy of the pope.

4AC4CA93430046A8AC2144E067815E7C.description: The student will list and explain the four marks of the Church (one, holy, catholic, and apostolic.)

3F414BB92E4C46AC8601862887BAB934.description: The student will discuss major heresies and the truths that are affirmed (i.e. Docetism, Arianism, Nestorianism, Monophysitism, Gnosticism, Jansenism, Iconoclasm, etc.).

57CDE3E60C174F578B8C20588721D1A4.description: The student will compare and contrast the Catholic beliefs of the Eucharist with the beliefs of non-Catholic Christians.

3149BAE2A03344578C1A6A4ED2885D32.description: The student will identify important historical figures in the Catholic Church in the United States and Colorado (see Appendix).

2DB6948A71D848CEA6F279F873D0B316.description: The student will retell the story of the saints instrumental in the growth of the Church throughout history.

2631CD53C546454DB61DCB296695C122.description: The student will name and briefly discuss documents of the Second Vatican Council.

8B1CFDD23C214553A2F144DEE7C52404.description: The student will identify the reason for the Council of Trent .

F1939F1F02DD40C3B929D5EC2079A3AF.description: The student will tell about the missionary activity of the Church throughout history.

3288EB835D66457EB7A81D7EE3822A73.description: The student will discuss the Reformation and the rise of Protestant churches.

75FF008A92B34A5A848752023B2EBF0E.description: The student will explain the reasons for and results of the Inquisition ,

109795EF9CD443A0A28B6D877471BF19.description: The student will discuss the reasons for and consequences of the schism between the Easter and the Western Church.

8F3895B2C4BF4CB582FEF13DFED5A8A1.description: The student will discuss the reasons for the Crusades and their result.

0344C8012E024634859A7DF4DFC86E5A.description: The student will identify the beginning of the Muslim religion, the birth of the prophet Mohammed, the growth of Islam.

7E16FF4A92D446DD90CCDBDA9D8A7856.description: The student will discuss the contribution of orders of religious and stages of religious life to the growth of the Church.

E34CCEE800594E68BC3AADC7E9098641.description: The student will identify early heresies and the councils that dealt with them, i.e. Nicaea.

1BD2377F6CF7442D894A4D2041197BB2.description: The student will explain the result of Constantine's recognition of the Church.

2080D225CC154901AAD2BF73B9904C2D.description: The student will trace the development of the Church through the Roman persecutions to the present.

1D7E1D5AA33E4070822CAE716FAAB678.description: The student will discuss apostolic succession .

C7DFB4A1E8C142D69B5F17F310A06FE0.description: The student will discuss the trials endured by the early disciples and apostles .

BB3859E40D3C48B38FFB642B83DA94EB.description: The student will retell the events of the Council of Jerusalem. Identify the most important issues decided there. (Acts 10-15)

CC3F0AC436FD4DE08E113EB046F3BECF.description: The student will discuss the missionary work of Paul and Barnabas .

15139223DE464424AD7005B89E281682.description: The student will tell about the conversion of Saul/Paul .

275FDFDD65D24C0BAB14094118DFDB4A.description: The student will discuss the selection of a replacement for Judas.

6430DC6F31D54B658DB052682A990E76.description: The student will explain Pentecost as the birthday of the Church.

686908AA064B4778A99FF62E504CF09C.description: The student will review the commandments, Beatitudes and the new law as the basis for Church moral teaching.

7B3334D940664828900724500ED9D4E9.description: The student will trace the growth of the Church beginning with Pentecost, through Paul’s journeys through the Acts of the Apostles and the Epistles.

E807FB22F13D449D899095A87CE09B52.description: The student will identify and discuss the New Testament passages where Jesus establishes his Church.
